page.title: 08RUDDINGTON PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: {RUDDINGTON}has seven public houses which is a lot for the size of the village.The {RED LION,}the{RED HEART and the {THREE CROWNS}are called Top, Middle and Bottom house because they are so close together on Easthorpe Street.The{RED LION}used to be in Vicarage Lane but the vicar in Victorian Times did not like it near the Vicarage. The{BRICKLAYERS ARMS,}the{JOLLY {FARMERS} the {VICTORIA TAVERN }and the {WHITE HORSE}all have seats outside so that children can be with their parents when they go for a drink. Morris Dancing sometimes takes place outside these pubs. Most of these pubs were started in Victorian times when the village had a large population working in the Framework Knitting Industry.Now people come by car to enjoy a village pub.
